question: From the following tools/techniques of genetic engineering, identify those which are required for cloning a bacterial gene in animal cells and choose the correct option:
I. Endonuclease
II. Ligase
III. A. tumefaciens
IV. Microinjection
V. Gene gun
VI. Lysozyme
VII. Cellulase
VIII. Electrophoresis
choices: II, III, IV, VI, VII, VIII
explanation: To clone a bacterial gene into animal cells: Restriction enzymes (Endonuclease - I) to cut DNA. Ligase (II) to join. Microinjection (IV) is a direct method for animal cells. Lysozyme (VI) to break bacterial cell wall to isolate DNA. Electrophoresis (VIII) to separate DNA fragments. *A. tumefaciens* and Gene gun are typically for plants. Cellulase is for plant cells.
